Hi, Dennis. I remember seeing your first question a week or two ago. If
you=
 didn't get any replies that suited you, it may mean that nobody
knows the =
answer offhand without looking at the source code. Which
reminds me, the so=
urce code to JUnit is really easy to read. Why don't

ind out for yourself? The code doesn't lie.

s is my second attempt at posting to this group.

mining if the time values generated by JUnit

benchmarking the unit under test.

at the setUp() times are

g of the

> 
> JUnit 4.3 looks very=
 nice, and we are also wondering if the 
> use of the @BeforeClass/@AfterCl=
ass Annotations will prevent 
> the setUp/tearDown times being included.
